1: It can go for days without eating a single morsel. In the bulb on its back, it stores energy.
2: The bud on its back grows by drawing energy. It gives off an aroma when it is ready to bloom.
3: The flower on its back catches the sun’s rays. The sunlight is then absorbed and used for energy.
4: The flame at the tip of its tail makes a sound as it burns. You can only hear it in quiet places.
5: Tough fights could excite this Pokémon. When excited, it may breathe out bluish-white flames.
6: When this Pokémon expels a blast of superhot fire, the red flame at the tip of its tail burns more intensely.
7: Shoots water at prey while in the water. Withdraws into its shell when in danger.
8: When tapped on its head, this Pokémon will pull it in, but its tail will still stick out a little bit.
9: Once it takes aim at its enemy, it blasts out water with even more force than a fire hose.
10: When attacked by bird Pokémon, it resists by releasing a terrifically strong odor from its antennae, but it often becomes their prey.
11: Its shell is filled with its soft innards. It doesn’t move much because of the risk it might carelessly spill its innards out.
12: Close examination of its large eyes reveals that each eye is composed of a myriad of tiny eyes.
13: Beware of the sharp stinger on its head. It hides in grass and bushes where it eats leaves.
14: Able to move only slightly. When endangered, it may stick out its stinger and poison its enemy.
15: It has three poisonous stingers on its forelegs and its tail. They are used to jab its enemy repeatedly.
16: Very docile. If attacked, it will often kick up sand to protect itself rather than fight back.
17: This Pokémon is full of vitality. It constantly flies around its large territory in search of prey.
18: This Pokémon flies at Mach 2 speed, seeking prey. Its large talons are feared as wicked weapons.
19: Its incisors continue growing until its death. If its Trainer doesn’t offer it a file to gnaw on, it will gnaw on door frames, table legs, and so on.
20: Its hind feet are webbed, so it’s a strong swimmer. It can cross rivers and sometimes even oceans.
21: Its short wings make it inept at flying. It moves about hurriedly and pecks at Bug-type Pokémon in the tall grass.
22: It’s tough and has excellent stamina. It has no problem flying continuously for a whole day carrying a heavy load.
23: By dislocating its jaw, it can swallow prey larger than itself. After a meal, it curls up and rests.
24: The latest research has determined that there are over 20 possible arrangements of the patterns on its stomach.
25: A plan was recently announced to gather many Pikachu and make an electric power plant.
26: It unleashes electric shocks that can reach 100,000 volts. When agitated, it can knock out even an Indian elephant.
27: It can roll its body into a ball. It moves through the desert by rolling at high speeds.
28: Although they are sharp, its claws and spikes often break off. They grow back the next day, so it is not bothered by the temporary loss.
29: A mild-mannered Pokémon that does not like to fight. Beware—its small horn secretes venom.
30: When resting deep in its burrow, its barbs always retract. This is proof that it is relaxed.
31: Tough scales cover the sturdy body of this Pokémon. It appears that the scales grow in cycles.
32: Its large ears are always kept upright. If it senses danger, it will attack with a poisonous sting.
33: Its horn contains venom. If it stabs an enemy with the horn, the impact makes the poison leak out.
34: Its steel-like hide adds to its powerful tackle. Its horns are so hard, they can pierce a diamond.
35: Its adorable behavior and appearance make it popular with men and women, young and old. Its numbers are few, however.
36: They don’t like to reveal themselves in front of people. They live quietly in packs deep in the mountains.
37: Its beautiful fur and tails have made it very popular. As it grows, its tails split to form more tails.
38: Legend has it that this mystical Pokémon was formed when nine saints coalesced into one.
39: It hugely inflates its stomach and sings a mysterious melody. If you hear this melody, you’ll become sleepy right away.
40: It sheds its fine fur when the seasons change. The fur is gathered and spun into a luxurious yarn.
41: It sleeps in caves during the day. It has no eyes, so to check its surroundings while flying, it emits ultrasonic waves.
42: Its thick fangs are hollow like straws, making them unexpectedly fragile. These fangs are specialized for sucking blood.
43: It may be mistaken for a clump of weeds. If you try to yank it out of the ground, it shrieks horribly.
44: Smells incredibly foul! However, around one out of a thousand people enjoy sniffing its nose-bending stink.
45: Flaps its broad flower petals to scatter its poisonous pollen. The flapping sound is very loud.
46: No matter how much it eats, the mushrooms growing on its back steal away most of the nutrients it consumes.
47: The large mushroom on its back controls it. It often fights over territory with Shiinotic.
48: Its large eyes act as radar. In a bright place, you can see that they are clusters of many tiny eyes.
49: The powdery scales on its wings are hard to remove from skin. They also contain poison that leaks out on contact.
50: It chews on plant roots underground. Farmers whose vegetables are vulnerable find it can be quite a pest.
51: This set of triplets moves cooperatively. It’s the power of teamwork that enables this Pokémon to dig to a depth of 60 miles.
52: It lies around all day, becoming active near dusk. At night, it wanders the city in search of loose change.
53: It has a violent temperament. It will attack anything that looks it in the eye. Its sharp claws inflict deep wounds.
54: As a result of headaches so fierce they cause it to cry, it sometimes uses psychokinesis without meaning to.
55: It is said that the red part of its forehead grants supernatural powers to those who possess one, so it was over-hunted in the past.
56: It can spontaneously become enraged. Everyone near it clears out as it rampages, and the resulting loneliness makes it angrier still.
57: It has been known to become so angry that it dies as a result. Its face looks peaceful in death, however.
58: It’s both clever and loyal, but if a stranger tries to invade its territory, it barks threateningly.
59: Overflowing with beauty and majesty, this strong Pokémon appears in ancient Eastern folklore.
60: The swirl on its belly is its internal organs showing through. If the swirl is tinged white, that means it’s affected by some disease.
61: Although it can live on land, it prefers to stay in the water, where it has fewer natural enemies.
62: Poliwrath in the Alola region are strong swimmers that use the breaststroke. Many children learn to swim by imitating Poliwrath.
63: It sleeps 18 hours a day. Even while sleeping, it will teleport itself to treetops and pick and eat berries there.
64: A theory exists that this Pokémon was a young boy who couldn’t control his psychic powers and ended up transformed into this Pokémon.
65: It is said to have an IQ of approximately 5,000. Its overflowing psychokinetic powers cause headaches to anyone nearby.
66: It loves working out. As it gazes at its muscles, which continue to swell day by day, it becomes more and more dedicated to its training.
67: As a result of its continual workouts, it has developed tremendous power. It uses that power to help people with their work.
68: It can lift heavy loads with the greatest of ease. It can even heft dump trucks. But its clumsy fingers prevent it from doing any precision work.
69: Prefers hot and humid places. It ensnares tiny bugs with its vines and devours them.
70: When hungry, it swallows anything that moves. Its hapless prey is dissolved by strong acids.
71: Lures prey with the sweet aroma of honey. Swallowed whole, the prey is dissolved in a day, bones and all.
72: They can be found lying dehydrated on beaches, but they are often still alive. When soaked in water, they will revive.
73: Normally, it has 80 poisonous tentacles. The longer one has been alive, the fewer tentacles it will have.
74: Its round body makes it easy to pick up, but it is hard and heavy. It’s dangerous to play with them as if they were snowballs.
75: Mossy rocks are its favorite food. It can devour a ton a day while crunching loudly.
76: Its body can survive dynamite blasts without a single scratch, but it hates rain and humidity.
77: Capable of jumping incredibly high. Its hooves and sturdy legs absorb the impact of a hard landing.
78: Just loves to run. If it sees something faster than itself, it will give chase at top speed.
79: Its long tail often breaks off. It doesn’t really feel any pain, though, and the tail grows back, so Slowpoke isn’t particularly bothered.
80: It spaces out while gazing at the sea. With Shellder’s poison flowing through its body, it becomes even spacier.
81: They gather in places where electricity is available. They can be found clinging to the steel towers used to support power lines.
82: When three Magnemite link together, their brains also become one. They do not become three times more intelligent.
83: They live where reedy plants grow. Farfetch’d are rarely seen, so it’s thought their numbers are decreasing.
84: Its short wings make flying difficult. Instead, this Pokémon runs at high speed on developed legs.
85: One of Doduo’s two heads splits to form a unique species. It runs close to 40 mph in prairies.
86: It has always been supposed that Seel live only in cold seas. Their having shown up in Alola is a mystery.
87: It swims through the ocean at a speed of eight knots, searching for Pokémon that will become its prey. It’s especially fond of Wishiwashi.
88: Its main source of food is the slimy industrial waste of factories. This Pokémon’s numbers have been decreasing in recent years.
89: The stench it gives off will make your nose scrunch up. Still, there are Muk fans who think that’s a good thing.
90: The hardness of its shell surpasses the hardness of a diamond. In days gone by, people used the shells to make shields.
91: Its hard shell cannot be shattered—not even by a bomb. The contents of the shell remain unknown.
92: Should a strange light be seen flickering in an abandoned building, Gastly is lurking there.
93: It strikes at humans from total darkness. Those licked by its cold tongue grow weaker with each passing day until they die.
94: Should you feel yourself attacked by a sudden chill, it is evidence of an approaching Gengar. There is no escaping it. Give up.
95: Burrows at high speed in search of food. The tunnels it leaves are used as homes by Diglett.
96: A Pokémon that nourishes itself by eating dreams, it is thought to share common ancestry with Munna and Musharna.
97: While it is an extremely dangerous Pokémon, people who are in need of a good, sound sleep call it their savior.
98: Its pincers are superb weapons. They sometimes break off during battle, but they grow back fast.
99: One claw grew massively and is as hard as steel. It has 10,000-horsepower strength. However, it is too heavy.
100: It is said to camouflage itself as a Poké Ball. It will self-destruct with very little stimulus.
101: Stores electrical energy inside its body. Even the slightest shock could trigger a huge explosion.
102: Its six eggs use telepathy to communicate among themselves. It is believed to carry plant genes and the genes of other species.
103: Each of its heads has its own will. They use telepathy to discuss their plans before coming to a joint decision.
104: When it thinks of its deceased mother, it weeps loudly. Mandibuzz that hear its cries will attack it from the air.
105: Originally, it was weak and timid. After evolution, its temperament becomes violent, and it begins to wield bones as weapons.
106: When kicking, the sole of its foot turns as hard as a diamond on impact and destroys its enemy.
107: Punches in corkscrew fashion. It can punch its way through a concrete wall like a drill.
108: It checks out whatever’s around it by licking everything. If you don’t clean off a spot where it’s licked you, you’ll break out in a rash!
109: In hot places, its internal gases could expand and explode without any warning. Be very careful!
110: This Pokémon lives and grows by absorbing poison gas, dust, and germs that exist inside garbage.
111: A Pokémon with a one-track mind. Once it charges, it won’t stop running until it falls asleep.
112: Its brain developed when it began walking on its hind legs. Its armor-like hide even repels molten lava.
113: The eggs laid by Chansey are rich in nutrients and a favorite food of many Pokémon.
114: Its identity is obscured by masses of thick blue vines. The vines are said to never stop growing.
115: Kangaskhan’s maternal love is so deep that it will brave death to protect its offspring.
116: If it senses any danger, it will vigorously spray water or a special type of ink from its mouth.
117: Touching the back fin causes numbness. It hooks its tail to coral to stay in place while sleeping.
118: When the weather grows warm, they form groups and swim upriver. This sight serves as a poetic reminder that spring has arrived.
119: When the weather grows cold, its whole body flushes a deep red. This sight serves as a poetic reminder that autumn has arrived.
120: Large numbers of these Pokémon make their home at the seaside. At night, a strange red glow radiates from the center of their bodies.
121: Its shining core is thought to receive and transmit enigmatic signals. It has been known to cause headaches in those who approach it.
122: Its pantomime skills are wonderful. You may become enraptured while watching it, but next thing you know, Mr. Mime has made a real wall.
123: It confuses its prey with its quick, ninja-like movements. Then, in an instant, it cleaves them with its scythes.
124: It sways its hips to a rhythm all its own. The precise movements of Jynx living in Alola are truly wonderful.
125: Half of all sudden blackouts are caused by Electabuzz gathering at electric power plants and gobbling up electricity.
126: When it’s tired, it leaps into the mouth of a volcano and soaks its body in magma to ease its weariness. Its body burns at 2,192 degrees F.
127: It grips its prey in its pincers and splits them apart. Although it is a powerful Pokémon, it can’t deal with the cold.
128: Historically, people in areas all over the world have ridden Tauros, but the practice is said to have started in Alola.
129: Although weak and helpless, this Pokémon is incredibly fertile. They exist in such multitudes, you’ll soon grow tired of seeing them.
130: A tale is told of a town that angered Gyarados. Before the sun rose the next day, flames utterly consumed the town, leaving not a trace behind.
131: Its high intelligence enables it to comprehend human speech. When it’s in a good mood, it sings in its beautiful voice.
132: It can reorganize its cells to make itself into a duplicate of anything it sees. The quality of the duplicate depends on the individual.
133: Possessing an unbalanced and unstable genetic makeup, it conceals many possible evolutions.
134: Its cells are composed of units much like water molecules. It lives close to water and is often mistaken for a mermaid.
135: They send out electrical charges of about 10,000 volts. Because they are high-strung, it can be difficult to grow close to them.
136: When it catches prey or finds berries, it breathes fire on them until they’re well done, and then it gobbles them up.
137: Roughly 20 years ago, it was artificially created, utilizing the latest technology of the time.
138: Omanyte lived in the seas of antiquity. Its fossils have been found bearing bite marks from Archeops, so apparently Archeops preyed on it.
139: Its heavy shell is thought to be the reason this ancient Pokémon died out. It’s apparently a distant ancestor of Octillery.
140: This Pokémon thrived 300 million years ago. It’s said that living specimens can still be seen in a certain region—a rare sight.
141: Its body had begun to change so it could function on land. But it didn’t adapt in time and went extinct.
142: A Pokémon from the age of the dinosaurs. It used its sawlike fangs to shred its prey before eating them.
143: Its stomach is said to be incomparably strong. Even Muk’s poison is nothing more than a hint of spice on Snorlax’s tongue.
144: A legendary bird Pokémon. It freezes water that is contained in winter air and makes it snow.
145: This legendary bird Pokémon is said to appear when the sky turns dark and lightning showers down.
146: A legendary bird Pokémon. As it flaps its flaming wings, even the night sky will turn red.
147: It grows by molting repeatedly. Boots made from the tanned cast-off skin are a super luxury item.
148: It has long been thought that its crystalline orbs are imbued with the power to control the weather.
149: This Pokémon saved a shipwrecked man, taking him to a remote island—a paradise occupied solely by Dragonite.
150: Its DNA is almost the same as Mew’s. However, its size and disposition are vastly different.
151: When viewed through a microscope, this Pokémon’s short, fine, delicate hair can be seen.
